intro: Acronia siphoglossa, commonly known as the narrow-leaf acronia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is native to the southeastern United States, where it typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland areas. The plant features slender, upright stems with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are bell-shaped, with five petals that range in color from white to pale blue. Acronia siphoglossa is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in shaded or partially sunny environments.
